making-their-way: Now Making Their Way to the Ring
role-help-text1: Start with +1 Heat with wrestlers of the opposite Role.
role-help-text2: You can use the Move of the same name by spending 2 Momentum.
role-help-text3: When you deliberately act against your role, it’s a Face Turn or a Heel Turn. Switch Roles, and gain +1 Heat with who you turn on (or away from).
spend-momentum-help: Spend to add to your result after any roll
heat-max-help: When you wrestle someone you have +4 Heat with, gain +1 Audience. If you don’t cross paths with someone in an Episode, lose -1 Heat with them.
want-help-text1: Pick the desire that most drives you. When you have a match that satisfies your Want, take an Advance and pick a new Want.
want-help-text2: You can also change Wants anytime (without taking an Advance).
audience-help-text1: This is how popular you are with the crowd.
you-start-and-reset-to-audience: You start and reset to audience
audience-help-topspot: Gain an Advance. Anyone you knock out of the Top Spot resets their Audience. Make the Over Move at the top of each Episode!
audience-help-text2: Gain an Advance. If you have 0 at the end of an Episode, you’re fired!
audience-help-jobber1: Gain an Advance. If you end an Episode at +4, you can choose to repackage to any other Gimmick. If you choose to stay a Jobber, reset to +1 at the beginning of the next Episode.
audience-help-jobber2: Gain an Advance. If you have 0 at the end of an Episode, reset your Audience!
audience-help-text3: Roll +Audience for: Work the Audience, Play Politics
advancement-trigger-1: Your Audience falls to 0 the first time in an Episode
advancement-trigger-3: You satisfy your Want (and pick a new one)
enter-specific-advancement: Enter advancement specific to your gimmick
you-can-spend-advances: You can spend Advances immediately, or bank them and spend them when you’d like.
